description: Detects named entities in input text when you use the pre-trained model. Detects custom entities if you have a custom entity recognition model. When detecting named entities using the pre-trained model, use plain text as the input. For more information about named entities, see Entities in the Comprehend Developer Guide. When you use a custom entity recognition model, you can input plain text or you can upload a single-page input document (text, PDF, Word, or image). If the system detects errors while processing a page in the input document, the API response includes an entry in Errors for each error. If the system detects a document-level error in your input document, the API returns an InvalidRequestException error response. For details about this exception, see Errors in semi-structured documents in the Comprehend Developer Guide.

parameters.name: LanguageCode
parameters.description: The language of the input documents. You can specify any of the primary languages supported by Amazon Comprehend. If your request includes the endpoint for a custom entity recognition model, Amazon Comprehend uses the language of your custom model, and it ignores any language code that you specify here. All input documents must be in the same language.

parameters.name: EndpointArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name of an endpoint that is associated with a custom entity recognition model. Provide an endpoint if you want to detect entities by using your own custom model instead of the default model that is used by Amazon Comprehend. If you specify an endpoint, Amazon Comprehend uses the language of your custom model, and it ignores any language code that you provide in your request. For information about endpoints, see Managing endpoints.

parameters.name: Bytes
parameters.description: This field applies only when you use a custom entity recognition model that was trained with PDF annotations. For other cases, enter your text input in the Text field. Use the Bytes parameter to input a text, PDF, Word or image file. Using a plain-text file in the Bytes parameter is equivelent to using the Text parameter (the Entities field in the response is identical). You can also use the Bytes parameter to input an Amazon Textract DetectDocumentText or AnalyzeDocument output file. Provide the input document as a sequence of base64-encoded bytes. If your code uses an Amazon Web Services SDK to detect entities, the SDK may encode the document file bytes for you. The maximum length of this field depends on the input document type. For details, see Inputs for real-time custom analysis in the Comprehend Developer Guide. If you use the Bytes parameter, do not use the Text parameter.

parameters.name: DocumentReaderConfig
parameters.description: Provides configuration parameters to override the default actions for extracting text from PDF documents and image files. This field defines the Amazon Textract API operation that Amazon Comprehend uses to extract text from PDF files and image files. Enter one of the following values: TEXTRACT_DETECT_DOCUMENT_TEXT - The Amazon Comprehend service uses the DetectDocumentText API operation. TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT - The Amazon Comprehend service uses the AnalyzeDocument API operation. DocumentReadMode (string) --- Determines the text extraction actions for PDF files. Enter one of the following values: SERVICE_DEFAULT - use the Amazon Comprehend service defaults for PDF files. FORCE_DOCUMENT_READ_ACTION - Amazon Comprehend uses the Textract API specified by DocumentReadAction for all PDF files, including digital PDF files. FeatureTypes (list) --- Specifies the type of Amazon Textract features to apply. If you chose TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT as the read action, you must specify one or both of the following values: TABLES - Returns additional information about any tables that are detected in the input document. FORMS - Returns additional information about any forms that are detected in the input document. (string) --- TABLES or FORMS.

nested_params.name: DocumentReadAction
nested_params.description: This field defines the Amazon Textract API operation that Amazon Comprehend uses to extract text from PDF files and image files. Enter one of the following values:

nested_params.name: DocumentReadMode
nested_params.description: Determines the text extraction actions for PDF files. Enter one of the following values:

nested_params.name: FeatureTypes
nested_params.description: Specifies the type of Amazon Textract features to apply. If you chose TEXTRACT_ANALYZE_DOCUMENT as the read action, you must specify one or both of the following values:

nested_items.name: Entities
nested_items.description: A collection of entities identified in the input text. For each entity, the response provides the entity text, entity type, where the entity text begins and ends, and the level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the detection.

nested_items.name: Score
nested_items.description: The level of confidence that Amazon Comprehend has in the accuracy of the detection.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The entity type. For entity detection using the built-in model, this field contains one of the standard entity types listed below.

nested_items.name: Text
nested_items.description: The text of the entity.

nested_items.name: BeginOffset
nested_items.description: The zero-based offset from the beginning of the source text to the first character in the entity.

nested_items.name: EndOffset
nested_items.description: The zero-based offset from the beginning of the source text to the last character in the entity.

nested_items.name: BlockReferences
nested_items.description: A reference to each block for this entity. This field is empty for plain-text input.

nested_items.name: BlockId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the block.

nested_items.name: BeginOffset
nested_items.description: Offset of the start of the block within its parent block.

nested_items.name: EndOffset
nested_items.description: Offset of the end of the block within its parent block.

nested_items.name: ChildBlocks
nested_items.description: List of child blocks within this block.

nested_items.name: ChildBlockId
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the child block.

nested_items.name: BeginOffset
nested_items.description: Offset of the start of the child block within its parent block.

nested_items.name: EndOffset
nested_items.description: Offset of the end of the child block within its parent block.

nested_items.name: DocumentMetadata
nested_items.description: Information about the document, discovered during text extraction. This field is present in the response only if your request used the Byte parameter.

nested_items.name: Pages
nested_items.description: Number of pages in the document.

nested_items.name: ExtractedCharacters
nested_items.description: List of pages in the document, with the number of characters extracted from each page.

nested_items.name: Page
nested_items.description: Page number.

nested_items.name: Count
nested_items.description: Number of characters extracted from each page.

nested_items.name: DocumentType
nested_items.description: The document type for each page in the input document. This field is present in the response only if your request used the Byte parameter.

nested_items.name: Page
nested_items.description: Page number.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Document type.

nested_items.name: Blocks
nested_items.description: Information about each block of text in the input document. Blocks are nested. A page block contains a block for each line of text, which contains a block for each word.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: Unique identifier for the block.

nested_items.name: BlockType
nested_items.description: The block represents a line of text or one word of text.
WORD - A word that's detected on a document page. A word is one or more ISO basic Latin script characters that aren't separated by spaces.
LINE - A string of tab-delimited, contiguous words that are detected on a document page.

nested_items.name: Text
nested_items.description: The word or line of text extracted from the block.

nested_items.name: Page
nested_items.description: Page number where the block appears.

nested_items.name: BoundingBox
nested_items.description: An axis-aligned coarse representation of the location of the recognized item on the document page.

nested_items.name: Height
nested_items.description: The height of the bounding box as a ratio of the overall document page height.

nested_items.name: Left
nested_items.description: The left coordinate of the bounding box as a ratio of overall document page width.

nested_items.name: Top
nested_items.description: The top coordinate of the bounding box as a ratio of overall document page height.

nested_items.name: Width
nested_items.description: The width of the bounding box as a ratio of the overall document page width.

nested_items.name: Polygon
nested_items.description: Within the bounding box, a fine-grained polygon around the recognized item.

nested_items.name: X
nested_items.description: The value of the X coordinate for a point on a polygon.

nested_items.name: Y
nested_items.description: The value of the Y coordinate for a point on a polygon.

nested_items.name: Relationships
nested_items.description: A list of child blocks of the current block. For example, a LINE object has child blocks for each WORD block that's part of the line of text.

nested_items.name: Ids
nested_items.description: Identifers of the child blocks.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: Only supported relationship is a child relationship.

nested_items.name: Errors
nested_items.description: Page-level errors that the system detected while processing the input document. The field is empty if the system encountered no errors.
TEXTRACT_BAD_PAGE - Amazon Textract cannot read the page. For more information about page limits in Amazon Textract, see Page Quotas in Amazon Textract.

TEXTRACT_PROVISIONED_THROUGHPUT_EXCEEDED - The number of requests exceeded your throughput limit. For more information about throughput quotas in Amazon Textract, see Default quotas in Amazon Textract.
PAGE_CHARACTERS_EXCEEDED - Too many text characters on the page (10,000 characters maximum).
PAGE_SIZE_EXCEEDED - The maximum page size is 10 MB.
INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR - The request encountered a service issue. Try the API request again.
